citeinfo.origin: U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Patoka River National Wildlife Refuge and Management Area (Data compiler)
citeinfo.title: PATOKA_RIVER_NWR_AREA_USFWS_IN: Ownership Status of Lands Within the Acquirement Boundary (U S Fish and Wildlife Service, 1:24000, Polygon Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service

citeinfo.othercit: This data set was provided to personnel of Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates (BLA) by Patoka River NWR personnel. Notification of purchased land is ongoing.

descript.abstract: PATOKA_RIVER_NWR_AREA_USFWS_IN is a polygon shapefile that depicts the ownership status of lands within the acquirement boundary of Patoka River National Wildlife Refuge, provided by Patoka River NWR. Lands are classified as Federal (USFWS), State (Pike State Forest), or Private. Users should be aware that other state lands including more tracts of the Pike State Forest and the Sugar Ridge Wildlife Management Area adjoin or are near the refuge purchase boundary depicted. The data set provided was in an ESRI shapefile format and was named Tract Owners 83. This file was cleaned and reattributed by Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates. The land within this shapefile is very near the legislative boundary, "the boundary of potential federal land acquisition", with only a small piece of USFWS owned land occurring outside this delineation. Some areas owned by FWS are closed to hunting, consult Patoka River NWR for information. This file is not survey quality. Boundaries were placed using USGS DRGs and lines were sometimes shifted (30-90 feet) to enable hardcopy presentation.
descript.purpose:
This dataset was compiled to provide locations and ownership status for lands within the Patoka River NWR acquirement boundary.
The following is excerpted from Patoka River NWR metadata -
"It is specifically not intended to be used as a land survey or representation of land for conveyance or tax purposes."

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 36.4 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Ownership status attributes of lands within the refuge acquirement boundary are accurate as of the publication date.

dataqual.logic: All polygons share snapped boundaries. There are no overlaps. Each record contains only a single polygon.
dataqual.complete: This file contains the ownership status of all lands within the refuge acquirement boundary one very small tract of land owned by the USFWS just outside and adjacent to the boundary.

horizpa.horizpar: Boundaries are mostly tied to USGS DRGs at 1:24000 scale. Evaluation of boundaries with aerial photographs at closer scales show some positional error.

srcinfo.srccontr: Base file to draw property boundaries

procstep.procdesc: Tract data from an Rbase database file that was used in the Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) process 1991 to 1994. The file was converted to ArcView sometime in 1997. Boundaries were drawn using USGS DRG files for guideance. Through time this file has been updated and projected as necessary.

cntperp.cntorg: U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Patoka River NWR&MA

procstep.procdesc: In order to correct known topological errors including overlaps and unsnapped boundaries, Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates created a new polygon shapefile by carefully tracing, at high resolution, the polygons of Tract Owners 83. Logical consistency problems (overlaps, snapping, and multi-polygon records) were corrected, however, no attempts were made to correct horizontal position, as it was determined that to do so without sufficient independent information on boundaries would degrade the integrity of the file. Inholding83 was used to cut out known inholdings within refuge property. Aquired83 and State83 were used to check the ownership attributes of the polygons. Some of Tract Owners 83 polygons were cut to reflect current ownership status. The ESRI ArcView 3.2 Geoprocessing extention, Dissolve function was then used to dissolve multiple, adjoining polygons with the same ownership status into a single polygon, eliminating the tract boundary lines, but still reflecting land ownership status.

Periodic updates on new land aquisition were sent to Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates from Patoka NWR as needed since the creation of the March 2005 file. These updates consisted of an email description of the tract purchased and its acreage, along with any notes of interest. These tracts identified in the updates were found in the Patoka Tracts files and then mereged into the federal ownership to create an updated land ownership file. Parcels with adjoining boundaries were unioned to create a single "federal ownership" polygon. The January 2006 updated "Acquired 83" file was used to check the position of updates and enter the purchase of tract 142 (8 ac) along with some adjoining acreage. The following tracts were added as federal ownership in the updated file - Tract 262 (Ferguson) (sent December 2005), tracts 59, 75, and 59a (sent January 2006), tracts 142 (8 ac) and 236 (6 ac) (sent March 2006), tract 77 (19.6 ac) (sent December 2006), and tract 169 (4 ac) (sent (February 2007).
Corrections were made to tracts 114, 98, 54, 160a, 143, 143c, 143d, 119 and 119b from comments from USFWS.

Updates were made based on information from Patoka River NWR. USFWS sent Tract Owners 83 file dated 6/15/2007
Compared it to patoka_tracts file, the following changes were made -
Creation of tract 46a - not owned Reshape of tract 43, owned Merging together a former 3 tracts of 226, state owned
The following differences were not changed, but correction was recommended to the FWS file
Additional land to tract 98 Merging borders of 2d Creation of tract 226b from former merged 226 to reflect land portion still privately owned Reshape of tract 160a to meet the refuge boundary Addition of the tract immediately west of 139, owned by the FWS Create tract 142a out of 142 to show new portion owned by the refuge Create 59a out of 120, to show new portion owned by the refuge
The updated tracts file was dissolved by ownership into federal, state, and private owned blocks.
Tract 144a (private) was added just south of 144, to show the sliver of land between the railroad and the highway.

Tracts 76, 76a, 76b, 160 and 160a were changed to federal ownership in Patoka_Tracts.shp. It was then dissolved by ownership to create an updated the layer. The ownership update was recieved from Patoka NWR by email on 20080207.

Corrections to the previous ownership update were recieved from Patoka NWR by email on 200802013. Tract 59a was merged into tract 161. Tracts 119 and 132 were changed to federal ownership and tract 143 was corrected to private ownership. The tract layer was dissolved to create the ownership layer.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

edom.edomvd: Lands owned by the Patoka River National Wildlife Refuge
Pike State Forest land owned by Indiana Department of Natural Resources

attr.attrdef: Acreage of the dissolved ownership block

distinfo.distliab:
No claims to accuracy are made on these data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
